flow.descriptionCdata:
6a49e6cf-cc4f-4006-b4ea-a6dec52f54db.1499d52b-dfbf-4cec-8971-e8b6c1a0fd4f.prompt=Virtual Machine\: 6a49e6cf-cc4f-4006-b4ea-a6dec52f54db.18f1c9d9-bd45-4993-8ed0-29d332394634.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
6a49e6cf-cc4f-4006-b4ea-a6dec52f54db.3628f377-1694-4abf-bd5f-ab4d551264df.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
6a49e6cf-cc4f-4006-b4ea-a6dec52f54db.4854b211-2e8c-443e-8543-3774a859c9d7.prompt=Enter password 6a49e6cf-cc4f-4006-b4ea-a6dec52f54db.4d7320fd-24a6-4cf1-8938-59c7a532b592.description=
Loops as many number of times as specified in the input, that is, counts from 1 to another number incrementing by 1 for each iteration.

Inputs\:
count - Number of loops to complete.
reset - If true, then the counter will restart counting from 1.

Returns\:
The number that was just counted.

Responses\:
has more 	- Counting has not completed, one or more iterations are pending.
no more 	- Counting completed. This will only be returned once, then counting restarts.
failure 	- Something went wrong.
6a49e6cf-cc4f-4006-b4ea-a6dec52f54db.546fe4b3-7af9-436f-9d73-c5460a0c388f.description=
Sleeps for the number of seconds specified in the input.

Inputs\:
seconds - The number of seconds to sleep.

Responses\:
success - Slept for the number of seconds given as input.
failure - Was unable to sleep for some reason.
6a49e6cf-cc4f-4006-b4ea-a6dec52f54db.645478fd-0b28-481b-a51a-4b850ec1bb76.prompt=Password\: 6a49e6cf-cc4f-4006-b4ea-a6dec52f54db.801d2103-cb5d-4e31-b71e-5125c42801c2.prompt=Virtual Machine\: 6a49e6cf-cc4f-4006-b4ea-a6dec52f54db.85e8c545-00c4-4176-808a-409a63392743.description=
Retrieve information about a virtual machine or a group of virtual machines in a datacenter or host system (pipe-delimited). Retrieve each object one at a time from an initial search query ala SQL Query operation.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
user - VMWare username.
password - VMWare user's password.
port - Port to connect on.
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https).
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
vmDatacenter - Virtual machine's datacenter.
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type.
hostSystem - Target virtual machine host system.
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/MyResourcePool/MyVM), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
getDetailed - Retrieve detailed information?

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
no more - there are no more results to retrieve.

Returns\:
vmInfo - Virtual machine information.
numberOfResults - Number of results from the query remaining to be retrieved.
returnResult - Virtual machine ID or operation results.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter or vSphere server the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter or vSphere client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
6a49e6cf-cc4f-4006-b4ea-a6dec52f54db.8b7a7275-dba3-42ff-ad93-ea5291b5bd31.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
6a49e6cf-cc4f-4006-b4ea-a6dec52f54db.a562d928-3e38-4626-bc7b-ff5aa442367c.description=
Sets the power state of virtual machine (poweredOn,poweredOff,paused). Does nothing if the virtual machine is already in the power state.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP
user - VMWare username
password - VMWare user's password
port - Port to connect on
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https)
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
async - Asynchronously perform the task
taskTimeOut - Time to wait before the operation is considered to have failed (seconds)
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/MyResourcePool/MyVM), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123)
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type
vmPowerState - Virtual machine power state to set (poweredOn, poweredOff, suspended).

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
no action - The operation completed with no action performed.

Returns\:
returnResult - Task ID or task completion return message.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter or vSphere server the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter or vSphere client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
6a49e6cf-cc4f-4006-b4ea-a6dec52f54db.b67b9c2f-b9ab-42a9-851d-3197382a3dd0.description=
Retrieve power state of virtual machine (poweredOn,poweredOff,suspended).

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
user - VMWare username.
password - VMWare user's password.
port - Port to connect on.
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https).
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation (true, false).
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type (inventorypath, name, ip, hostname, uuid, vmid).

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
returnResult - Task completion return message.
powerState - Power state (poweredOn,poweredOff,suspended).

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
6a49e6cf-cc4f-4006-b4ea-a6dec52f54db.c5971288-2c6a-4e2b-aac9-730d12ff9479.description=
Attempts to shutdown the guest virtual machine.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
user - VMWare username.
password - VMWare user's password.
port - Port to connect on.
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https).
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation (true, false).
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type (inventorypath, name, ip, hostname, uuid, vmid).

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
returnResult - Operation result message.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
6a49e6cf-cc4f-4006-b4ea-a6dec52f54db.description=
Changes a VM's power state. Must specify either hostSystem, clusterName, or vmResourcePool as a target location for VMs.

Input Parameters\:
 vmName - name of the VM that will be created with this flow
 templateName -  name of the VM template to clone in vCenter
 osType - linux or windows
 host -  vCenter host to execute against
 user - vCenter username
 password - vCenter password
 vmDatacenter -  target Datacenter on the vCenter host for the VMs
 dataStore -  target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs
 hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs
 clusterName - target cluster for the VMs
 vmResourcePool - target resource pool for the VMs
 vmPowerState - the desired power state (on / off etc)

Responses\:
   success - if the command completes execution and its exit code is 0
   failure - otherwise

Result Fields\:
 serviceXml - xml representation of the server created in vCenter
6a49e6cf-cc4f-4006-b4ea-a6dec52f54db.f4e2e4c8-2758-47bb-81e2-95f13decda29.prompt=Enter user
flow.name: vCenter Set Power State VM
